title: Care Partner Interview

title: Reserach assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy and straight to the point. One interview and the professor was kind and explained what the position entails and what would be expected of me during my time at the job.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have? Why this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: They asked about why I wanted to work at Vanderbilt. It is important to know someone who would want you to be part of their research team. In this way, your interview process is very simple and straightforward. They asked about your skills and interest.

title: Associate Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Appointment was made on teams app, then I logged in the app and had the interview live audio and video. The interview then lasted about one hours with two managers

title: MHT Interview

title: Patient Care Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: They reached very quick. The interview was easy and professional very relaxed and described the job very well. I spoke with 2 different people who explained each step of the hiring and training process.

title: Registered Nurse PACU Interview

Interview Descriptions: This was a scheduled panel interview with manager and 2 clinical leads/instructors. You have an option to choose what type of interview. Did virtual interview via Microsoft Teams. Discussed what you are going to do with the position you are applying to.

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy interview process. Once you complete the video interview and move onto the next step, it seems like they are trying to convince you to work there more than you are trying to convince them to hire you- there's a nursing shortage.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Treated me with respect, seemed interested in my responses to questions asked, polite people. For lab positions, they detailed clearly what the job position entails and what a day on the job would look like.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Assistant Director of Annual Giving and Stewardship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Their interview process is quite comprehensive ; after an initial screening interview with HR, you will meet with most members of your prospective team and applicable leaders within your prospective department
Interview Questions: What is your vision for this position and what do you bring to this position to meet that vision?

title: Real Estate Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy process with reasonable steps for hiring- not excessive interviewing. Generally a cal with internal recruiter and then meet with members of leadership on the team. Overall the process was quick and thorough.
Interview Questions: Very knowledge specific questions - almost like testing

title: Quality Review Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email to set up multiple Zoom interviews with different members of the team. The process took a couple of weeks. Everyone was nice and easy to work with.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time you worked with people different than you; how do you handle criticism; how would you describe your working style; how would your boss or coworkers describe you.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of both accounting related questions and personality fit. They also went over the job in detail which was appreciated. I was made an offer and accepted but contacted 2 days later and told they've decided to go with an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with month end (what is done on each day) and how many days has close been with your most recent companies?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth and everyone I met during the process was friendly and very willing to answer my questions. The hiring manager made me feel comfortable and at ease at all points. The timeline was also clearly communicated to me and maintained.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that would be beneficial to this role?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I met with multiple people (about 9) over a week throughout the process. Utilized a standard behavioral based question set. HR checked references (all very positive) and then I received a form rejection. Poor communication throughout the process.
Interview Questions: What was the job/result that I am most proud of.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It takes a while to get an interview and the process can be long but once you are through the process, it is a great company to work for. I have worked there three times and the experience was always worth the wait. They look for the right fit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant to the Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application on the VUMC careers website page. Received a phone call from the hiring manager three weeks later requesting a phone interview. Completed the phone interview and then was invited for a second interview in person a week later with two members of the administrative team for the department. After that interview was invited to a THIRD interview with the three physicians that this position would be supporting. Prior to the third interview was emailed a PDF containing information on the benefits available at VUMC along with another PDF explaining how their PTO program works. After both the second and third interviews was given an extensive tour of the area that this position would be working in and during both the second and third interviews, those that I was interviewing kept using the verbage "you will be doing this" "you will be supporting these people" "This is where you will be sitting". In an email that was received from one of the administrative staff members that I met with in the second interview she even stated that my skills and experience would allow me to be very successful in this position. One day after the third interview I received an email indicating that they wanted to obtain my references. VUMC uses an electronic reference service called Skill Survey. I was REQUIRED to provide FIVE references, two of which HAD to be either current or former managers. Hence I was very excited as normally reference checking is done prior to an offer for employment being extended. Thus I submitted the required information and sent the invitation to my references to fill out the form. I even ENSURED that they filled it out within twenty four hours as that is something that the Skill Survey notes in the summarized/aggregated report that is sent over to the hiring manager, how long it took your references to respond. The summarized report was sent late on a Thursday afternoon and by Monday afternoon I had not heard a word from the hiring manager and so I reached out to them. NOTHING, CRICKETS. Not happy at all, so I reached out to the person from the administrative staff that had emailed me previously and this person did respond to me. Unfortunately and quite shockingly they told me that I had STELLAR references, yet for some reason they saw the need to continue interviewing people and would be getting back to me in a couple of weeks?!! What in the heck?!! Had I known that they were not going to be offering me the job and were still interviewing people I would have NEVER provided my references, as it was a COMPLETE waste of my time and most importantly the people that I put down for my references time, and it was a bit embarrassing too, as I have NEVER heard of a company checking your references, having them come back great and then not offering you the job, but instead choosing to continue interviewing people. Absolutely ridiculous.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position? Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Had a voom interview. It was only supposed to be 15 minutes. I got in the interview and it was suppose to be two people but one had to go home and asked to texted when the interview was about to start. The other person never got on the interview. So she stated we would just continue with the interview. 45 mins later it was me asking all the question and the person interviewing me just talk about their personal life. At the very end of the interview I was told I was at a disadvantage cause the other person wasn’t on the meeting. If that was the case it should have been rescheduled and not continued with the inter for 45mins. Ridiculous. I even emailed the next morning asking if she would like to do another interview so the other person could be on it as well and never got a email back and didn’t know I wasn’t considered for the job until I actually logged on the companies website it’ll and it stated I wasn’t no longer under consideration. I wasn’t even given a chance.
Interview Questions: Was never asked interview questions.

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Lebanon, TN) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an in-person interview with the director, and it lasted about 30 minutes. At one point, someone joined the interview, but it was mainly with the director. She was nice and organized, which I appreciated. It was your average interview-style questions.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Some labs work with a recruiter to fill the position. Every position varies as far as interview process. One lab/PI required two interviews, half a dozen references, and a phone interview with my prior boss. In another I had one interview with the PI, then one interview with the lab members which was more of like a vibe check. Another lab just talked about experience and why I wanted to move to the city.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: If you have ever been apart of sorority recruitment/rush this process will be all to familiar to you. Not genuine, far too agreeable, and false promising. I felt like the interviewer were unprepared for my arrival and I felt like I showed up to a gathering uninvited.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself… more like dance jester dance hahahahhahaa 🤡

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview

title: Instructional Assistant Interview

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)

title: PHP Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview for remote PHP role with VICTR department that lasted about 45 minutes. There were standard questions about my background and current role - nice chat with the interviewers. I was told at the end that there would be a take-home assessment. I was told to work on it when I can for a week or two and there would be a code review with me afterwards. I complete it and turn it in after spending a lot of hours on it. After a few days, I get a generic "no longer a candidate" email. No code review, no feedback on my performance, nothing. I asked for feedback and was ignored. If you are a developer, I wouldn't recommend applying at all.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The Interview process is not difficult. I met with the Director it was overall an average experience. I received a job offer in about a month. The onboarding process can be time-consuming.
Interview Questions: What is your management style

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was very situation oriented. Lots of questions. Lots of brain picking. I definitely suggest preparing before by thinking through specific clinical examples (questions were centered on team work, conflict, safety, resources, personal skills, why vanderbilt and why the specific unit)
Interview Questions: Q. Describe a situation when you feared for the safety of a patient or coworker.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received an email after applying and had an interview the following week. I was then contacted the next week and had another interview that same week. I was not contacted about being declined an offer. I had to check the online portal.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview process lasted thirty minutes. Lab manager asked basic questions about my future plans, strengths, experience with computers. Job description was vague so I just came prepped with basic questions about schedule, day to day tasked, etc.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Sr. Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I have made it the last round twice. Each department is different.

First time
Round 1 - Phone Screening/ Recruiter
Round 2 - In-person interview with administrative staff of department
Round 3 - Zoom calls with four directors
Round 4 - In-person interview with four directors

Second Time
Round 1 - Phone interview with Director for the department
Round 2- In- person interview with two managers and two admin staff
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Projects Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The application was lengthy and was basically a substitution for a phone screen. After about two weeks, I got invited by a recruiter via email to do a 1:1 interview with who would be my direct supervisor. After a week or so, the recruiter asked me to schedule a second round of interviews consisting of 1-on-1 30 minute conversations with 5 people from across the department, including an assistant director, project managers, and people in the position I was applying for. Most of the questions were personality related. Everyone was extremely friendly and only had genuinely nice things to say about VICTR;  I could tell that it would be a wonderful team to be a part of. Two days after that, I asked the recruiter what the next steps would be and she said that they were currently still in the interview phase, but I should receive a rejection or offer by email. (With no specific time frame) However, 3 weeks went by and I hadn't heard back, so I contacted one of the people I interviewed with her to reiterate my interest. I didn't receive a response from her, but about two days later I got the rejection email from the recruiter. All in all it was a good experience and I'm disappointed it didn't work out. My only complaints are: A) some of the interviewers had little to no experience with interviewing people and B) I wish they hadn't left me hanging so long.
Interview Questions: So tell us about yourself.

title: Lead health data coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth. I applied on 8/06/20 and I was called for an interview on 8/19/20.  The hiring manager told me that it would be about two and a half weeks before I would hear anything. I was contacted by HR on 8/31/20 with my offer.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to deal with something that was difficult. How did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. Probably 5 staff and myself sitting at a round table. They went around the room each asking their questions. It almost appeared that they were not interested in being there as if they already  made a selection/knew who they were going to select.
Interview Questions: Very long specific situational questions...

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Got an email about an interview and scheduled about a week later. Heard back 3 months later for a second interview. Assuming it took longer because of COVID. Have not done the second interview, During the first it was a panel interview with other doctors and admin assistants.
Interview Questions: What is a time where you had a negative situation with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed twice they were always late. For it to be a professional career job didn’t get back to you if they didn’t think you fit the job description. Just leave you hanging no feedback.
Interview Questions: Why choose Vanderbilt as a option?

title: Associate Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I felt very comfortable. We discussed what the job would entail. The interviewer gave a very descriptive and detailed job description.  In conclusion, it was a very pleasant interview experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received an email interview where I sent back my responses by email, then next step was video interview with two managers, then few days later video interviewed with two more people.
Interview Questions: Have you ever dealt with a coworker that you didn’t get along with and how did you handle it?

title: Nursing Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: One on one with the unit manager in a conference room and then a tour of the unit. It took about 1 hour from start to finish. It was very informal and she told me there was no reason to be nervous as it was going to be very informal.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at VUMC

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the department you're interviewing with - mine happened to be on the more casual side. Definitely review some of their recent publications and have questions prepared on their research.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, phone interview with MD that was very enthusiastic, then in person interview to meet team and tour facility.  I was told I was a great fit. After a week no formal rejection message, only a vague response to wish me luck. Vanderbilt likes to amass a large pool of candidates to boost their ego, I later found out they chose someone with a connection to another MD that worked there, so they probably never planned on hiring anyone else. Felt like a waste of time. It is still a good place to start out, but it is better to know from the start that they are known to do this.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work history. Why do you want to work with us?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was very personable. I was interviewed during the pandemic so although we were social distancing and wearing masks, I felt comfortable. The questions were straight forward and general. I was most impressed by being asked about my career goals as growth is important to me with any job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next year?

title: Social Worker (BSW) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
1st virtual via zoom, with two social workers, both asked questions
2nd in-person, social workers, clinic manager
The first interview took place via Zoom, and two social workers asked me questions. I had applied to the position the week prior and I got the call for the interview that very next week. The second interview was in person at the Children's Hospital and this interview was done by multiple social workers and the clinic manager.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your prior experience?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was brief. She asked me a couple of questions, I responded with the right answers and was hired. I don't know what this new NM is like. It was me and the NM at the time. She obviously trying  to fill her positions quickly.
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral what would you do in this situation style questions.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted 2 days after applying, spoke with HR before my interview about benefits and other details about the job. Had a phone interview and was given an official offer 2 days later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you said something you shouldn’t have to a patient.

title: Associate Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very detailed. I meet with individuals in the role i was currently applying for and upper management, all in one day.  After that was complete i was called back for a second interview with faculty.
Interview Questions: strengths/weaknesses, previous experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. I received an email setting up the interview. Met with two HR ladies and was asked standard interview questions.Usually there would have been a second interview but both decided against it and offered me the position after the first interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well organized and very efficient. I was able to meet multiple people while I was there and I felt as if all of my questions were answered. The overall interview process was much quicker than I expected from such a large company as well.
Interview Questions: What quality do you think qualifies you most for this position

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Hour long interview. All were friendly and made me feel at-ease. It took about 2 weeks from the time I applied online to receive an on-site interview. I haven't heard anything back yet, but I feel like they truly asked the right questions to understand what kind of employee I would be.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Audiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included an initial online screening about background and interest and was followed up with a phone call and in person interview. The interview process was fair and timely.
Interview Questions: Asked about interests, teamwork, VUMC, and strengths.

title: Mental Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a friend who was able to put in a word with their recruiter. I was then invited to a recruiting event where the interview took place. It was pretty quick and easy.
Interview Questions: They asked about my previous experience

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview process. The interviewer spoke the majority of the interview and only asked a few questions. She was very nice though and made it a comfortable experience.
Interview Questions: When was one time you made a mistake?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted through email about going through a phone screening as my profile matched what they were looking for. During the phone screening, they asked me about my research experience, went through my background and education, and asked me about relocating and a projected start date. The next day, they got back to me about scheduling a video interview within the next week. During that interview, it was a panel of the three people I would be working closest with, and it was mostly entry level questions. It was a back and forth conversation, and lasted around 40 minutes. They said that they would get back to me within a week, and they got to me the next Monday about offering to hire me (interview was Thursday). From then, it was about three weeks later that I received an official offer from the hiring manager because they were away.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go into clinical research?

title: Exercise Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy online questionnaire, easy phone interview, once they told me what my expected pay would be I had to decline. Not worth pursuing the job IMO.  Doesn’t pay competitively and benefits are pretty standard.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you worked with a difficult patient and how you resolved it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the recruiter and a phone interview was setup with HR. I then had an in-person interview with several people/departments. Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: After filling out my application, an interview was scheduled with me within 2-3 weeks. The whole application/interview process was very well organized. Communication was quick and concise. You will be interviewed by managers, nurses, etc. from the area you are interviewing for. I think this is good, but if you don't get an offer from that specific track, then you are out of luck. My best advice if you really want to work at Vandy is to pick a track like acute care/med-surg where there will likely be more positions open. I also wish that the people interviewing me could have been the ones to follow up, and at least provided some feedback. I thought the interview went very well, so I would have liked to have known their reasoning if possible.
Interview Questions: "Tell us about a time when you noticed a patient needed immediate nursing intervention. What did you do, and what was the outcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, very serious, but they also cared a lot about getting to know me. Asked about clinical experience and what type of department I was currently working in
Interview Questions: What is an experience you have had in practice and how did you handle it?

title: Associate Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with my current manager and then sat and spoke to her manager. I also got a chance to sit and chat with some of the people I work with now. Took a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: What are some obstacles you had to over come in your last job?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was currently in the process of moving from CA to TN, I had an interview with Pediatrics GI, Heptalogy and Nutrition Department. Since I am located in  California still they were able to do a Skype Interview. I was a great experience, the interviewers were so kind and it felt like I knew them forever. They seemed very passionate about their department. We talked on Skype for about 45 mins,  When I got the bid for the position I had the weekend to think it over and discuss it with my Husband, We came to the conclusion that we were taking a loss and it wasnt going to be a beneficial move for us. I checked in with the hiring manager to see if we were able to negotiate the cost, unfortunately they are firm on their offers. I was not able to negotiate the salary. I respectfully declined the offer.
Interview Questions: Three adjectives you would use to describe yourself, Three adjectives your coworkers would use to describe you , Three adjectives your managers would use to describe you.

title: Inpatient Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, she was very polite and professional. I really enjoyed the interview. She was very informative and kind. I was left feeling very comfortable about the process and possibilities.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to critique a co-worker and how they took it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: First you get a phone screen then if you pass that well you will be invited for an in-site visit. Normally interview takes about half a day and you get chance to share your story with different people from that specific department. You will be asked some behavioral and specific scientific questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
two rounds  - behavioral and technical.

Firstly, you would have a conversation with the HR and managers where they ask more about the behavioral and previous work experience and some of the best projects you worked on and if you are proud of those.
Interview Questions: SQL questions and what is success? and some Tableau related question

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy, detailed questions inquiring on your experience and fit with the program. 8-10 different interviewers, many of which asked the same questions. Some are behavioral and some are more open-ended standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work history.

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Average interview, asked behavioral questions. They were friendly, made tou feel comfortable. They were honest about working there. They list the pros and cons about working in the area.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The full extent of my responsibilities was kept from me during the interview.  It was not until the second day on the job that it was revealed I would also be taking on the duties of an outgoing administrative assistant temporarily as they looked for a replacement.  This lasted for three months!
Interview Questions: The usual questions: Why am I looking for another opportunity?  Why Vanderbilt?  What was a challenging workplace situation and how did I resolve the matter?

title: BIA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy interview but mostly nontechnical questions. It was not about skills but mostly about the personality of the candidate. As long as you are confident and friendly, you will have a higher chance of getting hired.
Interview Questions: Why Vanderbilt?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: An HR representative sets up a screening phone interview. If she thinks you may be a fit she sends your CV to the hiring Director who then sets up an interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work experience.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with three physicians plus inpatient team I would like to join. Was escorted (so nice!!) by office members as I would never have found individual offices on my own.
Interview Questions: Expectations for employment time commitment, amount of experience in the field

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Received a telephone interview (a basic employee screening) a couple weeks after submitting my resume. Then received an in person interview the next week. The process was easy and smooth.
Interview Questions: Questions were to be expected from an interview.

title: Health Policy Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly standard. I had a phone call with the manager, and Skype interviews with two faculty members and one analyst. Questions were mostly about my background and behavioral. Most of the people I interviewed with already knew of my experience, and so the process was fairly straightforward.
Interview Questions: Tell us about an analytic project you have worked on focusing on the technical aspects

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at 9 am that morning, and received an email that evening that I was the leading candidate and they wanted to move forward. After checking my references  the total process was a bout 1 week and half
Interview Questions: What was my experience with calendar management

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 5 panels: 1- with would-be peers, 2- would-be direct reports, 3- key stakeholders (other nurse leaders),  4- the CNO, and 5- my future boss. ~Six situational targeted selection questions at each, looking for situation, action, and result.
Interview Questions: What was a change you were asked to make that you didn't agree with and how did you handle it?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: 1 round. 1 in person interview with whole team. Panel of 3-5 people. Hard to find parking. Make sure you show up early. Very basic interview questions. Not hard at all. Looking for fresh graduates with limited experience.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Goodlettsville, TN) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two managers, very laid back environment. Questions were fairly easy. Once the interview was over, I was shown the pharmacy and how a typical work day goes. Interviewed on a Friday and accepted the job offer on a Tuesday.
Interview Questions: How well do I handle conflicts in the work place?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of multiple groups from various disciplines (i.e. Managers from other departments, staff nurses, providers affiliated with the department and nursing administration.) The Interviews are established based on the Targeted Selection model and behavioral based questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a project in which you did not see eye to eye with your peer and how did you go about reaching a final conclusion or outcome

title: Surgery Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel of management and physicians, mostly situational questions, very informal and personable interview, lengthy interviews and a very long process from the date you apply to the date of offer,
Interview Questions: Why Vanderbilt?

title: Registered Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had to interview in person 3 times, coming in out of state. staff was not considerate of time spent on traveling for these interviews. they need to consolidate interviews, otherwise should offer phone or skype interviews.
Interview Questions: what was a specific time you had to deal with difficult patients, and how did you resolve the problem

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Tallahassee, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: very easy, comfortable setting. Interviewers had their questions but I was prepared with my answers. I spent alot of time defining my goals before the interview - something I recommend all to do
Interview Questions: Tell us why you want to work here

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The two people who interviewed me were hilarious and so easy to talk to. They made me feel very comfortable. It was the unit manager and the nurse educator. I interviewed for a pediatric unit.
Interview Questions: Why Vanderbilt?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Human Resources team and nurse recruiters contacted me and set up and interview with the nurse managers of the unit shortly thereafter. I interviewed with two nurse managers from my department in a relaxed and comfortable environment.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time that you experienced conflict with a coworker and how did you mitigate the conflict.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Try to match you with an individual professor or team leader, so that you could start working right after you begin your PhD study.  Lunch with Dean and dinner with current students. Very fun!
Interview Questions: Research experience, how to tackle problem

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview. Interviewers remained professional yet made me still feel comfortable.  Residency program sent PowerPoint explaining the interview beforehand and the interview stayed true to outline on PowerPoint. Be able to present clinical experiences.
Interview Questions: Why  did you choose Vanderbilt?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I felt that the interviewer was friendly and encouraging. The interview setting was comfortable and the atmosphere was very relaxed. Everyone I came in contact with at the facility welcomed me with open arms.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Vanderbilt?

title: Physician, Hematology/Oncology Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Easy and straightforward- great administrative assistants to help you navigate you through the process. Easy to follow and everyone is so nice and friendly! Beautiful city too and everyone is cordial and nice
Interview Questions: They asked about my prior research experience

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with recruiter with potential in-person interview. Hourly range was lower then current wage but recruiter did let me know they would discuss with hiring manager. The recruiter said if the hiring manager was willing to negotiate for experience, they would follow up for in-person interview. However, this was not the case so  I only had a phone interview.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have  inputting healthcare data?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Was initially invited to an interview with the Database Administrator. We spoke for about an hour, describing the database and what it does, the position, and my previous employment. Was told I would be contacted the next week, and did not hear anything for almost two weeks.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Learning Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was quite long and excessive for the most part. It started with a phone screen and after about five (5) weeks of waiting, I get a call out of the blue to do a phone interview. About a week elapsed after that and then a little more than an hour later was invited in for a face-to-face interview round robin.

The interview in person lasted close to four (4) hours. The feedback they provided was very positive (well, so it was thought). It included meeting with everyone in the department and everyone seemed positive with the answers provided and the truths provided. It also included a presentation which was completed in the allotted time with all required specifications.

Then after that, crickets for about three (3) weeks. Shortly after that, at about 7pm mind you, I was rejected. NO FEEDBACK WAS PROVIDED WHY AND NONE WILL EVER BE GIVEN BECAUSE THEY USED CANNED EMAILS JUST TO GET YOU OUT OF THEIR WAY!!!

I wish they were more upfront and honest about the interview process and provided constructive feedback when it was asked. It was unprofessional to lead me to believe that I had a great interview only to find out that the materials provided likely were just thrown away. 

Also, because I DO NOT HAVE CAPTIVATE, it was a likely another reason to reject. You can't download a trial every time you interview just for the sake of it when funds are tight otherwise.
Interview Questions: Please create a 15-minute presentation on how to balance a checkbook. They prefer

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two part interview. First was with multiple people in multiple departments, to see where the candidate might fit in best, second was with the direct hiring managers who were interested.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions about former employment history, experience, and what hobbies you have outside of work.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: First there is a phone interview, which was very positive.  You feel like you're talking to a friend you have known for a long time.  Next they send you an online assessment to be sure you are suited to the job.  After you pass, you are offered an in-person interview.  I did a background check also.  I received an offer the same day I interviewed, which really made me feel invaluable.  I am looking forward to working for a world renowned medical corporation.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have for this type of work, which is customer and patient related?

title: Medical Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. My hiring manager was eating lunch when I arrived and during the interview. She was quick to find a list of jobs for me and offered me the position.
Interview Questions: What makes you unique?

title: Data Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview with two managers, 1 hour, discussed my fit in terms of immediate needs of the project, and my long term career goals, tested language abilities, asked a lot of questions of my own
Interview Questions: Why are you prepared for this job?

title: Observation Unit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions:
Questions on various scenarios with patients and coworkers. Example: How would you handle a situation with a difficult patient? 

Asked a lot of scenario questions about emergency situations. And he sure to ask questions about how to advance within the organization. Vanderbilt is huge about their Magnet Status, as well.
Interview Questions: If you have a disagreement with a coworker, how would you try to resolve the issue?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Multiple pages of questions with multiple people. Lengthy and very in depth about your clinical knowledge. Basically you are back in school. Slightly intimidating how much info you have to give them.
Interview Questions: Page and 1/2 of clinical questions. 2 pages of interview questions. List the blood flow

title: MHS Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It consist of a phone interview and then a face to face with the manager. We were asked questions about past work experiences and warned of the sometimes difficult nature of working in a psychiatric hospital.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you overcome conflict in the workplace.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial online application followed by a supplemental application with a due date.  I was kept informed throughout the entire process. Interview was a panel with five people based mostly on behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you'd like to work here.

title: Neonate Pediatric Transport Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: A phone call to verify things and get to know the supervisor. Then an interview with the supervisor and other leadership. A second interview with others from the same department.
Interview Questions: What was a time that you had conflict and how did you deal with it?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Begins with HR process online, then a phone screening from HR and finally a phone interview. From there I was brought in for a panel interview the next week. Usually takes one-two weeks total.
Interview Questions: What is your dream job?

title: Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and was called a week later.  We set up an interview and I was offered the job that day.  I then started the job 3 weeks later due to personal reasons.
Interview Questions: Name a time that you have used your skills to over come something.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had 4 different interviews spread out across 3 months. It was a long process with very little information about the next steps or when a decision might be made.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at Vanderbilt?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and two weeks later received an email from HR asking me to fill out a questionnaire about past experience. Two weeks later received an email to have a phone interview. Brief introduction followed by a series scenario questions to test statistical knowledge. Some general questions were asked at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: How would you interpret the result of a logistic regression to your collaborator?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on Vanderbilt Medical Centre Career site. The process took 3+ months. I was contacted by the recruiter and a interview with the hiring manager was set up. The recruiter and manager I spoke to were very friendly.
Interview Questions: Difference between Business Intelligence and Business Analysis? What do you like the most?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Just basic questions. I had two 1:1's and then a small group interview. Nice people, but definitely not used to interviewing people: Why us? What would your former boss say about you? What is your greatest strength and weakness?
Interview Questions: Are you organized?

title: Mental Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Poor, judgemental, and bias. It was made clear during the hiring process that my degrees would not be utilized. However, I needed the job and benefits.

Interviewers were unfriendly and not involved in the day-to-day operations of the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Charge Integrity Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was okay I met with the Assistant Director and two other ladies in the department.  One of the ladies during the interview did not ask any questions overall the interview was basic and I was not asked any unusual questions,
Interview Questions: My experience and background in healthcare.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for Nurse Residency Program. I chose a track but was not selected for the one I chose but given another option. Dates for interview times were sent and I replied back with when I would chose to come in. The interview was a panel of 3 people some on the units I was interviewing for and some were not. Questions were all situational based. Want specific clinical examples related to things like patient satisfaction, teamwork, and decision making.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation about a patient where you had to make a difficult decision or change

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 2 Charge Nurses and 1 RN in a laid back atmosphere. One of the charge nurses ended up being my manager once I was hired. It was helpful that she had been in on the interview process.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work here?

title: Product Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Not too bad.  Standard questions.  Interviewed with several members of the team.  Laid back conversational style.  No Panel Interview.  Lasted about 4 hours altogether.  Asked about background and skills.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Vanderbilt?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (New York, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received call for interview, came in the next day, was hired shortly after. Manager was very blunt during the interview process and had extremely high expectations. I did not expect to get the job, as I did not feel that I lived up to the expectations of the manager. However, I was given the opportunity in spite of all of this.
Interview Questions: What are you going to do for me?

title: Database Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got a 1st round HR interview through phone. After a week I met the team for a Technical interview which lasted for an hour and 2 weeks later, I got a call from the employer the job was confirmed and the salary and processing were discussed.
Interview Questions: How do you use joins in SQL?

title: Medical Records Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview took place at the Grassmere location.  There were three coordinators that conducted the interview.  The interview was conversational and took about an hour.  They were very friendly and keep the conversation going.
Interview Questions: Are you planning on staying here for the full year long contract term?

title: Payer Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line. Contacted by HR and had an additional phone interview with Director.  They were more than flexible with my schedule for interviewing. The interview lasted about 45 minutes to an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?  How would you handle a disagreement with a payer?

title: Ophthalmic Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process took forever! It was 3 months before HR got ahold of me to schedule an interview. There was no skills assessment. The pay rate offered was based on what I was earning at my last employer.
Interview Questions: They asked if I could perform tonometry (duh).

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at Vanderbilt University Medical Center was an in person and formal setting. The interview was with the head of the department who asked a series of multiple questions to learn who I was beyond my resume and cover letter.
Interview Questions: What is your five-year plan?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy and relatively straight forward. I only interviewed with one person and was offered the job on the spot. I started a few weeks after.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: No interview; had informal meeting with potential PI and was offered job shortly after.  Hiring was confusing because VU/VUMC split was occurring and no one knew who I belonged too...
Interview Questions: Just had informal discussion about potential projects since PI was already familiar with my research experience.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by a recruiter a month after applying for the job online. Vanderbilt requests initial video interviews now. I was unable to do the video interview. Per the option in the initial email I received, I requested a phone interview. The recruiter stated that it was not a problem and sent me a link to her calendar. I scheduled an interview about 4 days out. I received a confirmation email. I never received a call for my interview. I waited 20 minutes beyond my interview time, left her a voicemail and sent her an email. The recruiter didn't respond. The following Monday, I sent an email to the general HR mailbox with Vanderbilt located on the careers webpage. I finally get a response from the initial "recruiter" stating that the position is filled. The position is still listed on the site as available. This all transpired within a matter of a few days. What was so hard about shooting me an email before the scheduled time to let me know that? I had to move some things around to make time for a phone interview by the deadline.

I forwarded my previous emails to the HR manager and director. No response from them, which is not surprising.  I didn't think the "recruiter" had a right to get away with being unprofessional. It's not even about the job. It's about having some common courtesy and respect for my time. She is the one who contacted me for the interview. I believe she just didn't want to be bothered with a phone interview. It's disheartening to be looking for a job, having to deal with employed individuals who aren't even doing their job. Recruiters who don't recruit makes no sense at all.
Interview Questions: Was not contacted for an interview

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked a few basic questions concerning technical and behavioral skillsets. Did not ask any trick questions, they just wanted to know how capable and committed I could be to learn and handle the laboratory techniques
Interview Questions: Do you know how to do PCR?

title: IT Process Owner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online application initiated the process.  Conducted 3+ phone interviews with the IT director and members of his staff group.  Culminated with them flying me to Nashville for 5-6 hours of face-to-face interviews with most members of the IT staff.  Most questions were situational from either past experience or what-if type questions.  After returning home, they contacted me with an offer previously negotiated and are following up with a formal offer sheet and benefits package list.
Interview Questions: How did you manage a previous incident or problem that your own IT support staff caused?  Also asked many pop quiz type questions concerning the specific area the job was for.

title: Insurance Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview for a job where you have to verify patients insurance. They ask me several questions. What was my strength.  What wad my weakness.  Did i have experience with verifying. Insurance
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for another job

title: Health Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
A recruiter from HR contacted me for a phone screen interview. 
She asked me typical questions regard to my work experience.
The entire interview took about 15 minutes.
She said she was going to get back to me after meeting with the faculty, but never came back.
Interview Questions: What statistical methods do you use for your daily work?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a number of people.  The interview process was very professional and pleasant.  It was nice getting feedback and questions from various people with different perspectives about the job.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in an environment where there were people of all cultures and races? How did you work with them?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an unformal discussion, a researcher to researcher discussion about ongoing projects in the lab and mutual interests. We went through my CV and saw how I can be a plus for the lab.
Interview Questions: My current project and interests

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two phone calls before I did a video interview.  The video interview was awkward as they could see me but I could not see them. It was difficult to read the room and know when to talk and not
Interview Questions: What qualifications do you have? Why are you applying to this position?

title: New Graduate Nurse Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: They start out by asking you general questions such as where you see yourself in 5 years, why you want this position, etc. Then they go into situation-based questions (about 5 of them) and give you time at the end to ask questions. I had 3 people conducting the interview - a nurse from the floor I was applying for and 2 people from management/leadership.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to research a patient and how it resolved.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It went well. They were very professional and made you feel comfortable the whole time. They asked a lot of good questions. I had no problems at all with the process.
Interview Questions: What is your previous work experience

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview then an in person interview, I am currently in a phase where I provide references and after 5 references are reviewed they can make a hiring decision. Of course I dont understand what that means, am I still in a pool of people or do they want to offer pending my reference review (which of course they will be good why would I pick poor references you know) So just waiting
Interview Questions: Comment on how you stopped something bad from happening (safety)

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done by a panel of the service managers. They took turns asking you questions. They are looking for an example of a situation, how you handled it or responded to it, and what was the outcome of the situation. They want you to demonstrate critical thinking skills.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had a difference of opinion, and how you handled it.

title: Community Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Great. The interviewers were friendly and interested in my experience. I had a chance to ask questions and felt like they were honest about pros and cons about the organization. Overall a really great experience
Interview Questions: My experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted Principal Investigator via email, received response and invitation to visit for in person full day interview (gave 1 hour talk on research and met with members of lab in addition to PI)
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after finishing your postdoc?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: A typical hour long talk on previous research and one on ones with six different faculty members.  Everyone was very enjoyable to talk to and no one was overly critical.  Most of the interviews were just conversations about science in general.
Interview Questions: Career goals and interest in an academic career

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and it lasted 30 minutes. I had two interviewers and they made me feel very comfortable. They just wanted to get to know more about me and why I wanted to work for VUMC and their department. It was a pleasant experience and I wouldn't change anything about it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to get into healthcare?

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
They take their time for their fit, and as long as it took - I find it to be very worth it. 

Phone interview, in person interview, background check, a formal offer, and orientation.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Dialysis RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Through networking, I reached out to the unit and came up for a visit. I was encouraged to apply for a position, so I did. From there my application was in the hands of HR, which was honestly a bit of a frustrating and lengthy process. There was a 30 minute phone interview with an HR personnel which frankly seemed inappropriate to me -- why is someone with no experience working in health care giving me a preliminary interview?? I have worked with HR departments previously of course in my field, but they seemed extra involved here. Maybe that's just the way things are done now, I'm not sure. Next I had my official interview with the Unit Manager and a Director over the unit. I was offered the position right away and just had to wait for HR to complete my background checks and send the official offer. It was time-consuming and it felt like HR was very much a middle-man, but it ultimately worked out so I have no real complaints about the process.
Interview Questions: Specifically which procedures I was proficient at.

title: Associate IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone screen with a recruiter from Vanderbilt HR discussing my experience and qualifications. After completing the phone interview was informed that I would be getting an email to schedule an in-person interview.

Two days later I got an email scheduling a group interview with the department's IT staff less than a week later. In the group interview I met the team leader and two members of the three member staff. In addition to the IT staff I was also interviewed by a member of the leadership team.  

I was initially asked questions regarding how I would handle difficult situations and being asked to compromise my integrity. After that I was asked a series of round robin questions from the IT staff that included technical and non-technical questions.
Interview Questions: If you could have any superpower what would it be?

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short, sweet, to the point. No messing around. I was overqualified with my experience & was told during the interview that I had already made it to the final round/meet & greet and that they just had me come in for HR reasons/fairness to other candidates. Interviewer was very kind.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in five years?
Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for a lab new to Vanderbilt and only lasted a couple of hours as they had not set up yet. It involved speaking with a researcher about my past experiences. This was different from another interview I had with an established lab at Vanderbilt where I met and interviewed with the entire team including the lead investigator.  Both involved lab tours.
Interview Questions: Have you performed mammalian tissue culture before?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview. Arrive night before, dinner with PI that evening. Next day meet with members of lab, give research talk, tour of lab facility, more meetings and then done and gone.
Interview Questions: no difficult or unexpected questions

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I first submitted for the role in June 2015.  I didn't hear anything for a while, then I got a call asking me questions about working in the medical area/a specific department.  It sounded like they were interested, so I wasn't surprised when I got another call a couple weeks later.  However, it dawned on me in the middle of that conversation it was a different department calling.  This time they sent me a questionnaire to fill out.  I had a panel interview with some wonderful people via phone which went very well but then I didn't hear anything for several days.  I needed to make a decision about either moving to TN or move in town so when I didn't hear anything, I made the incorrect assumption they weren't interested so we moved in town.

Five days after we moved, they called me to see if I could come for what I believed were to be the final, in person interviews.  I told them during this time they would have to pay relocation, as we had just moved.  I was ecstatic when they called to offer me the job but devastated that I needed to turn it down because they weren't able to pay enough for relocation, even though I truly believe they tried.  SO disappointed, as they are a fantastic group of people.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?  Why are you in the job market?

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I've had three interviews: Blood Bank, Microbiology, and Molecular Diagnostics. Each was conducted with two or more people in different conference rooms. They all felt very similar as Vanderbilt has a script they use for interviews. Micro stuck to it like glue but Blood Bank and Molecular were far more relaxed and casual.
Interview Questions: Typical and expected questions: tell us about yourself, why did you choose to apply here, greatest weakness/strength, tell about a time of coworker conflict, ect.

title: Data Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was lengthy. It was pretty smooth. HR contacted me initially for phone interview then I had an interview with 2 supervisors and a few higher-ups in the office. After that, there was a panel interview with the other DC's. 

Beware of this job. The job description listed on Vandy's HR website is totally inaccurate. Does not match the actual responsibilities at all. Basically sitting in a dark area with little to no interaction with others while reading electronic patient complaints. There is little room for upward mobility and it pays VERY little. Only offered at 30hrs/wk but is still considered FT. The metrics and standards they keep to are unrealistic. The current supervisor is extremely incompetent and uneducated.
