If you are trying to "get in the door" at Vandy, this job serves its purpose but after a year or so, RUN!!! Pay is not worth the responsibility.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working in an environment where all you do all day is read patient complaints?

title: Laboratory Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process takes a long time compared to other jobs I have had. I applied online for the job. One week later, I recieved an email for a pre interview screening. One week after I submitted the screening answers, I was contacted for an in person interview that was scheduled for another week out. The interview questions were pretty standard. The wanted to know a lot about your knowledge of laboratory procedures as well as a few personality questions. My two interviewers were great and very personable. The interview lasted about 20 to 30 minutes. After the interview, it took 2 1/2 weeks to hear back. They made me an offer that I accepted and have not regret it since.
Interview Questions: Name the order of draw for a phlebotomist.

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: HR interview and on-site interview with a variety of personnel one would be collaborating with in normal work functions.  Presentation required.   Typical interview process- not a whole lot of surprises.
Interview Questions: Why Vanderbilt?

title: Contact Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: pretty much the normal thing.  Tell me about your history by walking us through your prior work experience.  What is your greatest weakness and strength?  Why did you leave your last position? When would you be available?  What is the salary you are looking for?
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in a contact center.

title: Research Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The interviews cumulatively were the most lengthy I have ever experienced. The interview day itself lasted 4.5 hours and consisted of talking separately with 8 people, each asking me the same questions. It was exhausting and inefficient to have to discuss the same things with each person, when a modified format would have been more pleasant, less draining, and require me to repeat myself less.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They contact you for a phone interview and then you can have up to 3 different face to face interviews depending on the position which you are applying for.  They have practicum job related questions.  They are nice when interviewing but stick to the facts don't ramble and don't talk to much about yourself or where you see yourself fitting in unless asked specifically those questions.  Also go into 2525 West End and apply on their computers.  Ask all the questions you have to those ladies at HR Express they are a huge assists.  Even if you get the job I can guarantee you, that you will be calling them asking questions.  Also be on your best behavior and be nice to everyone you have no clue who knows who.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you have had workplace differences describe to me the situation surrounding the conflict the steps which you took and the outcome.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fast and smooth. First there was a phone interview from one of the managers. During this I got to learn about nurse:patient ratios, number of beds on the unit, acuity of the patients, etc. At the end of the interview I was offered a face-to-face interview, with an option to do it on Skype (I lived about three hours away). I chose to drive to the hospital for the interview to get a better feel of the atmosphere and also places to live near the hospital. The assistant managers interviewed me and gave me a tour of the unit. They were very forthcoming and helpful, even talking about possible orientation dates.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time when you had a difficult patient, and how did you deal with that?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed by the administrative manager of department that had the opening requesting a phone interview. After a quick email conversation a phone interview was set for the next day. The Phone interview lasted about 30 minutes. She Asked some situational questions (what would you do if...), some personality questions (how do you deal with...), and some job experience questions (list your job duties at your previous job.
Interview Questions: If someone was calling, someone walked in and a coworker needed your help at the same time what would you do?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went through a local recruiting firm to get the interview initially. The interview was scheduled quickly.The questions in the interview were directed mainly at job skills, with some additional focus on working style. The interview was conducted by two members of the current staff, including the manager that the position reported to. Overall, the interview was pleasant but the questions required thoughtful answers.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the use of Microsoft Project and Visio?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: As a student, the undergrad work/study program was was easy to understand in terms of the hiring process. What I've heard from full time staff is that the interview process is straightforward and simple as well. Getting the job required quite a bit of past experience, and also a strong interest in the work to be done and matching up with Vanderbilt's creed and values.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with multitasking?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy talked about my employment history and how I could contribute to the Clinical staffing resource centre.  I had one interview with the manager and was contacted quickly with the job offer
Interview Questions: What is your work history and how will you contribute to full-fill our mission.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They were quick! Applied and got a call for an interview same day. They will take anyone with a BSN and a valid RN license. Offer next day. It was very easy process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 yrs?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter reached out to me on linked in and got me in contact with the hiring manager within a day. Had two phone interviews with the director and associate director, then was brought in for an onsite interview. Took about 5 weeks.
Interview Questions: I can't really recall any challenging questions asked.

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online in October 2014. Contacted for a brief phone screening with HR about a month later. Pretty basic questions, like describing my education and current experience, explaining why I wanted the job, etc. Contacted several weeks after that by hiring manager of the department. I was living in another state, so he interviewed me by phone and we set up an in-person interview for later in the month when I would be in town for the holidays. More detailed questions this time, such as describing how I handle conflict, strengths and weaknesses, where I see my career path going. After that interview, he wanted me to meet with another manager in the department the following week. Pretty much the same questions as the first manager.

All in all, four interviews and a three month application process for a very basic, entry-level position! But part of that was due to my living out of state, and I was contacted just a few days after the final interview and offered the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation at you work that you didn't handle well, and what do you wish you had done instead?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Initial application was submitted through the VUMC career center website. There was almost a two-month lapse of time before any communication was received, regarding a screening interview via phone with an HR employee. That interview consisted of general behavioral questions, such as "Why choose to work at VUMC? What is your general philosophy when dealing with conflict? What makes you the most qualified candidate?" and the like. I then received a phone call two weeks later from the departmental manager, who discussed the details of the position as well as conducted an informal phone interview. The following week that departmental manager called to set up a face-to-face panel interview consisting of the manager and the department NPs. This interview consisted of more NP-specific behavioral questions where the interviewer provides a topic/scenario, and I had to describe an applicable experience of my own, what I did, and what I learned from that experience.

I did not get the job due to lack of experience, but it was a positive interviewing experience overall. Everyone was friendly and kind, and although the questions were somewhat difficult, it was a fairly informal and comfortable atmosphere interviewing with this particular department.
Interview Questions: Describe a clinical situation where you went above and beyond your job requirements.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a panel of interviewers asking questions and talking over each other at times.  Did not appear very professional and I felt like they had not interviewed in this manner very much in the past - it seemed like they did not know what they were doing.  In addition, the interview itself did not seem like it was objective - it was like they had already decided on who they wanted to hire and was just going through the motions while interviewing me.
Interview Questions: What makes you think that you would be a good fit?  Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nash, TN) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: There are at least 2 or more people interviewing you up here so be prepared to face more than one person the interviews are quite difficult and not as easy as interviewing for a regular job.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose to work here

title: Health Systems Database Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: There were a series of interviews, with not only the team I would be working on, but other people within the VUMC system. The interviews were extensive, but there were no tests (like I have seen in other reviews). It is harder to get through the original HR screening process than the interview process. The original HR process depends in part because of whose desk the application lands on. When I was helping select candidates to interview once I was part of the VUMC family, I was sometimes frustrated on who got through and who didn't. It is a really good employer for middle Tennessee.
Interview Questions: No real unexpected questions. If you have read a good interview book (e.g., Knock 'Em Dead), you will be fine.

title: Mental Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic. Conducted a phone interview with HR. Then got passed along to a panel interview with the 3 coordinators from each department (children, adolescent, and geriatrics). Later, I received an e-mail from one of the coordinators offering me the position. Furthermore HR then called me to provide me with details about benefits and pay. I got offered around 13.00 an hour. Unfortunately, with costs of my daycare and gas, etc. I was not financially able to accept the job. Furthermore, through negotiation It was extremely difficult to get specific answers regarding my hours/shift, specifically days and times which made it difficult to figure out childcare.
Interview Questions: Pretty typical interview questions. Strengths/weaknesses, past experiences. They did ask a lot of questions involving how you would handle a specific situaition and asking you to describe a situation in which you demonstrated a positive quality (such as leadership).

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very casual interview, replied to online job posting by email and was quickly (within 2 weeks) contacted to ask for available time slots. I went directly to the laboratory I would work for and spoke with the lab manager. Very nice woman who seemed to be focused mostly on finding an assistant whose personality matched with the lab.
Interview Questions: It was primarily a getting-to-know-you type of interview. Talked about future career plans, etc.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Overall, the interview experience was very positive.  There is such a thing as southern hospitality.  The questions, however, were VERY difficult.  I was not expecting such questions, especially as a new grad (we barely have any experience!).  But the interviewers were nice and I enjoyed talking with them.
Interview Questions: "Tell us about at time when you noticed that a patient required a medical intervention.  What cues told you so, what did you do, and how did it resolve?" (as a new grad, that question was pretty intense.

title: Business Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call screening first. Then a regular interview, then a PEER interview. Was hired after manager's friend accepted a position elsewhere.
Interview Questions: If you had a choice on a snowy. icy  day to drive to work or stay home, which would you choose.

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: One interview, had to start as a temporary employee
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions

title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the application, I received the response by email for setting up the interview date within a week. Also I had a friend woking in the new place so I contacted her prior to the application. I think this helped me have such a short period of waiting time prior to the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your strength, weakness, reason to leave the previous unit/place, what to learn and plan in a new job place

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward process.  A relatively long wait to hear back.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, face-to-face interview in during which interviewer asked me about previous jobs listed on my resume. Got the interview after responding to a job post online. The whole process was pretty quick and lasted a little over a week from the time I applied to the time that I received an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to complete usual tasks on top of meeting multiple deadlines around the same time.

title: Certified Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick face-to-face interview with private duty manager. Asked a series of behavioral and situational questions related to healthcare. Asked about my previous experience working in healthcare. Asked about my academic goals and ambition.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been faced with a situation where you were unable to fulfill a task on your own. How did you proceed?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: New grad online application submitted before the winter holidays, then an interview a few months later.   After interview process option of in-person or skype.  Offer's were sent out again a few months later.  When I applied you either applied for critical care or acute care.  Then during orientation you had brief interview with each unit within the tract you were selected for and then given your unit placement.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Professional, accurate representation of job
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: For leadership nursing roles, a new process is in place that is really intimidating and bazaar.  Applicants meet with several groups over a few hours.  One group is upper administration, one is peers, and one is management.  They take turns asking all scenario questions and you must state what you did and the outcome.  Everything you say is written down and then it is scored.  It is an event in which several applicants participate, but each is interviewed with the group individually.
Interview Questions: Name a situation in which you had to research a problem and used resources outside of the normally provided.  What did you do and what was the outcome?

title: Health Systems Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The process was very unique as Vanderbilt has a different atmosphere than most companies.
Interview Questions: Given specific situations to test skills.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Phone prescreening, initial interview with hiring manager/director, group interview with team
Interview Questions: All were typical Targeted Selection questions

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Multiple phone interviews followed by a couple in-person interviews. Most were one-on-one but a couple were group interviews. Some of the interviews were more technical Q&A while some of the interviews were more conversational in nature. Overall I was impressed by the level of interest in my previous work and their interest in what I thought I could bring to the organization.
Interview Questions: Detailed technical questions in addition to some common interview-y type questions.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very planned out. The interviewer is given a set of questions, i assume from HR,  and they must ask you every question on the list. It took over 5 months for me to hear back that I was awarded the job. VUMC's interview process is extremely slow and poorly managed.
Interview Questions: Past experience

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I worked at Vanderbilt for 15 years in the same department, at the time I was interviewed it was a very casual interview.  During my time we started to use a interview tool that required canidates to go through 3 different people of which I was one of them.  The tool we used really allowed us to get an insite on how they would perform.
Interview Questions: Describe an interaction you had with a customer/patient that was difficult to handle.  Why was it difficult what did you do and what was the out come.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I got this job through a temp agency in the area. It was pretty direct to hire. As long as you show enthusiasm and do the work they need, you'll do great!
Interview Questions: There weren't any difficult questions. Very straight forward.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is variable and dependent on whether an individual is currently employed in the organization. Once passed the Human Resources portion, the interviewers are consistent and professional.
The interview process for nursing, in my experience, follows standards of best practice. As a Magnet awarded facility the organization strives to maintain high standards which are expressed in the interview process.
Interview Questions: Standard

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Twice yearly process where RNs out of school or with less than 6 months experience are chosen to interview/hire. Submit your application, if you meet the cut off score you interview, then best candidates chosen based on overall score of application/interview questions. You and 3-4 people across from you, interviewing you, using ruberics to score each question. They might be nurse managers, asst mgrs (CSL), educators, administrators. They ask clinical questions and what you would do in that situation.
Interview Questions: I'm sorry, I don't remember. Something about, "Tell about a time you successfully educated a patient on an issue."

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Spokane, WA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the nurse residency program.  My panel interview was over Skype because I could not travel from Washington to Nashville.  It went as smooth as a Skype interview can and everyone was very nice.  Before the interview, someone from the recruiting office called me to make sure I was set up on my end and then we proceeded with the actual interview.
Interview Questions: They asked many behavioral based questions, "describe a time when...."

title: Research Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Took about three weeks to have interview and background check to return.
Interview Questions: Not any difficult questions.

title: SharePoint Integration Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The conversation with the Technical Recruiter was friendly, informative, and overall a pleasant experience. He asked me to contact him in a couple weeks to ensure the Hiring Manager had gotten in touch with me. I left a follow-up email and voicemail, but never received a response from either him or the Manager. It's a shame, because my background and my desire to be in an academic environment would have meshed very well.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were typical Q&A from both myself and the Technical Recruiter. Nothing was difficult.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: My interview was very friendly, I felt at ease throughout. The questions were straight forward, and I feel mainly to get an idea about my temperament as a person, employee and co-worker (to supplement what they already knew from my resume and cover letter/e-mail. It was short and to the point, and they let me know in a very timely fashion whether or not I got the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous experience in this field? What is your level of interest in this type of work/career path?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied and got called for an interview within a month. The first interview was with a recruiter, with questions regarding my background. The second interview was about 30 minutes with the one of the senior employees on the team. I also interviewed with the hiring manager on the same day. This interview was about 30-45 minutes. I received a thank you for coming in to interview, later that day. This was followed up with an offer, contingent on a background check.  I accepted the job and really enjoyed the work there.
Interview Questions: What's your methodology for handling projects.

title: Health Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview here for me was in Jan of 2007. The interview started in the morning and lasted the entire day. I met with most of the doctors and Team leads for both technical interviews and regular interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you monitor applications in an environment where there is no standard for app servers, or technology developing the application?

title: Temporary Sub Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great and offered many chance for carrier. Detailed on education and personal; experience
Interview Questions: are you willing to adapt to any shift

title: Undergraduate Research Analyst/Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I went to the career fair in August and gave out my resume to the places I was interested in working for. I got called back for an interview by a staff member for a position in a research study the next day. I did the interview the following week, followed by a second interview with the principal investigator for the study. After these interviews I got the job and chose to accept.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? What are your previous experiences working in a clinical setting? What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses? What do you hope to accomplish here? Where do you want to be in 10 years?

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was a internal hire by a PI. I didn't deal with HR at any point during the process. I had previously demonstrated my effectiveness as a researcher and group leader, and the PI was interested in skill sets that made me a unique addition to their team. I have found Vanderbilt HR to be exceedingly policy driven.
Interview Questions: What form will success in this position take?

title: Client Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial email with recruiting agent, then brought onsite for a group Interview with team members. I immediately had a 20 minute interview with the program managers and COO, and a 5 minute interview with President (mostly a formality at that point). I was offered the role later that day.
Interview Questions: What do you know about malpractice insurance?

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: A simple on site interview. Wasn't tough at all. They asked all relevant questions which were very easy to answer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Software Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two at a time interviews, all day.  Spoke with about 10 different people.  None of the questions were hard, just common sense stuff for an experienced programmer.  A lot easier than some start-up interviews I've had over the years.
Interview Questions: Do you validate a web form client-side with Javascript or server-side?

title: Senior QA Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: All day process from peers to managers to executives. Some team based, some individual. Treated with great respect. Very laid back and personable. Felt immediately welcomed. Potential team members took me to lunch. Was tired, but felt very good about the interview and got the job. Some difficult questions. Personality based and skills based questions. Most centered around team fit.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation at work, how I handled it, outcomes, and what I learned from it.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Arrived on time. Met with HR mgr, then met hiring mgr. After interview,  was escorted to work area to meet workers. Process was roughly  two hours. Then was hired same day.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about  yourself

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Simple phone interview that sounded very scripted and mostly went over my submitted resume. Nothing too challenging was asked. Vanderbilt hiring managers are required to ask the same scripted interview questions, regardless of department. They are very predictable and boring.
Interview Questions: Standard strengths and weakness type questions.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions:
All applications are online.  You never speak to anyone in HR. Someone from the hiring manager's office will call or e-mail you.  The process is very slow.  Be prepared to wait up to 30 days before someone contacts you.   You may start with 1:1 and then proceed to group interviews. or vice-versa.    The university prefers behavioral interviews and gives the hiring managers templates of questions,. 

The after-interview process is also a long period.  You may never hear from the again, or you may receive a e-mail form letter from HR stating that they hired someone else.
Interview Questions: What would be your fantasy job--not related the position you're applied for today?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Franklin, TN) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with an excellent match for stated qualifications needed. Contacted within 24 hours to schedule a phone interview. Wonderful conversation with a recruiter. It appeared that the recruitment office is somewhat disconnected from the hiring department -  the recruiter only had very general answers. However, the recruiter was very helpful and assured me that the department manager could answer the questions or she would find the answers herself. We set up a time for me to talk to the department manager via phone. However, I accepted a position elsewhere before being invited for a live interview.
Interview Questions: How has your professional background made you an appropriate candidate for this position?

title: Budget/Accounting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had a three one-on-one interviews with two administrative officers and a group interview with the individuals that I would be working with.  the questions asked were about my past work experience and how my skills would assist me in being a successful Budget/Accounting Analyst. the one-on-one interviews lasted about an hour and my group interview was thirty minuets.
Interview Questions: my goals for the next 5 years

title: Playroom Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then waited for several weeks to hear back. I was offered an interview and then went to my scheduled date. The interview was short but filled with many direct questions aimed at finding out why I deserved this job more than other applicants. After the interview I was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Why should you get this job over the other applicants?

title: Office Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Standard Targeted Selection questions. Interview with Manager first, followed by group interview. Was very laid back. Lasted 45 minutes total. Interviews were scheduled just a few days apart, so I knew pretty quickly that I had gotten the job. This was an internal transfer/promotion. I was a little disappointed to find that the pay increase was not going to be as high as I wanted it to be. However, I accepted because at the time, I wanted to stay at Vanderbilt long term... Thought other management opportunities would become available. That was not the case.
Interview Questions: All were Targeted Selection questions.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: In brief, I applied by email to a scientist and fixed an interview date. Then I gave a presentation and got the offer the very same day. I was also asked to go out on lunch with the rest of the colleagues to learn more about the supervisor and get second opinion before I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their jobs website. It took a few weeks to hear back from them. Met with hiring manager for the unit as well as member of staff whom I would be working with. I felt good after the interview and was called back within a couple of weeks with the job offer. The hiring process takes so long that I had also had two other interviews in different departments after my initial before I was hired at neuro.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a care partner.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Easy going.  I gave an hour long presentation of my previous work, spoke to lab members, and was hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, lots of people to meet with and it takes a long time to navigate the process
Interview Questions: what is your biggest weakness.

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by panels. The entire day of interviews did not include a tour of the nursing unit. I had to request this. I had to pay for my own plane ticket, and was told that the person hired for the position would be reimbursed for the plane fare.  Once hired, I had to be very persistent before the expense was reimbursed.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected questions.

title: Research Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I approached a lab I wanted to work in, sent in my resume, and came for an interview. It lasted two days and I was offered the position the day of my interview. Hiring took a little while, but I was unable to start the position for several months, so the actual hiring process was not expedited.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected was asked

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: It is very difficult to get salary information. Vanderbilt has a system where the hiring manager "does not have control" over the offered salary, and instead says that Personnel sets the salary based on the candidate's experience and education. It is difficult to circumvent the system. You will have to apply through the online system and, if it kicks you out as not appropriate for a particular job, it is almost impossible to do anything to make your case.
Interview Questions: None - interview was easy.

title: Transportation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process takes at least 3 weeks,Interview process is easy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (Nashville, TN) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an employee who I had worked with previously. I had a phone interview initially with the employee who Id be working under and then went to Nashville to meet with the department head. The interview process was relatively informal with the basic questions about future plans, previous work experiences, and interests in the health field.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years
